title: Can we please make runes cheaper/free.
body:
I'm fed up of having to invest thousands of IP just for a few runes, I have to spend 3690 for 9 410ip runes (The most used ones).
That means if I wanted a full set without quints I would need 11070 IP, including quints (1025, the good ones) that's 14145 ip. That's ridiculous. With that I could buy 2 6300ip champs. 

And this still doesn't account the fact you need more than just 1 page, some of them with completely different runes.

replies.body:
On a related note, I find that new players I try to get into this game get frustrated not having runes and feel stretched between buying runes and champions. 

What if Riot gave you a free rune every time you leveled up? When you level up and unlock a seal slot (yellow), then they give you a tier 3 armor seal. I'd suggest:
Marks (red): Flat AD
Seals (yellow): Flat Armor
Glyphs (blue): Flat MR
Quints (?): Flat health

At least that way, everyone has at least one full rune page at level 30. If you want to specialize, then you have to pay. For those of us already level 30, then you get the runes free or equivalent IP (at your discretion? if you already own these specific runes?). 

Arguably, if I love playing mages, then AD Marks aren't very great. Hybrid Penetration Marks are more general. But I'm not sure if Riot would go for giving out Hybrid Pen Marks: I suspect that's a big IP sink for them.

P.S. You can equip Tier 3 runes as a summoner less than level 20, you just can't buy them. At least, that was my experience when the Digital Collector's Pack came with Tier 3 runes.
Infinite crisis does something similar. when you level up you get a choice between 3

Pick one:
marks: flat AS, flat AD, magic pen
Seals: flat Armor, flat health (or scaling?), gold/10
Glyphs: flat Mres, AP, CDR (or mana regen?)
Quints: AD/AP/MS (there are too many possiblities tbh, but I guess this covers the majority)
Mana regen seals are better than mana regen glyphs.

Its da truth. Hard to get anybody into actually playing the game when they're playing at a disadvantage for their first 365 games (The average amount it takes to get to level 30 which is needed to unlock all the rune slots and mastery points) If your system requires 182 hours of play time (With an average game length of 30 mins) to be on an even playing field with everyone else your system is pretty fucked. Especially compared to the closes competitor in dota.
You're just too lazy to play the game and earn the paper, brah.

Or he has a life and choses to only play 1-2 maybe 3 games a day. Which is how much time maximum people should spent on video games. Apart from that, even for people who play more than that it takes too long, did i mention SMURFS, yes people have smurfs and this shit takes forever to do and buy runes for, unless you make a smurf to play two seasons later...

Ummmmm......... smurfs having less shit is fine. Smurfs are generally for having an account that is lower mmr than your main, so not having as many options balances out that you are playing against weaker players than you usually do, and I don't really think we should make it easier to beat up on people below you (but maybe that's just me).

Also if you play 2 games a day holy shit you you get about 200 for a win (which you should hit one a day, you can play a 15 minute bot game on easy if you don't get one in your one or two games), and like 60-80 for what ever you get on the second. Even if we assume the low number of 250 a day for IP that way (which means over two games you only need 50 points each game since you get 150 free for fwotd), then you're making 1750 IP a week (1k w/ 3 days of no games). That takes a while, but that's also for a FULL page, you can add 9 of any one thing in like 2-3 weeks which isn't great but isn't the worst.

If we assume a more ridiculous 3 games a day you should be getting 300-350 IP consistently w/out any problem. That's 2100-2450 IP a week. In a month that's 8400-9800 IP. Suddenly you're adding stuff really fast (think about it, there are generally months and months between champ releases, so you have time).

It is definitely a grind, but considering you only need 16 champs for ranked and 2-3 rune pages will generally cover everything you need (to a minimum at least, it's not the worst thing ever. Personally I use the same two pages for 90% of my games (early ap vs scaling ap based on if I have kill pressure early), I rotate other stuff sometimes, but honestly I'm just lazy and forget to switch it a lot bc a good general page does what I need for the most part, and I stopped playing most of the champs I wanted a really specific page for.

The situation isn't as bad as you're making it out to be.  Many of the Runes you would want are useful for multiple champions, so it's not like you're having to pay 14k IP for a set of Runes for each and every champion you have.

Given I bought Akali for 4800 IP, and now I have to buy Hybrid Penetration marks for 7380 Ip, no, it's not over exagerated. It costs more to have runes than to get a champion. Why do 9 marks cost more than a new champion? I know it's only 80 IP more than a newly released champion, but it's still a lot for someone who hasn't been playing long.

I've been playing roughly a year now and I still don't have all the champions I want, let a lot a lot of runes. I actually had to go out of my way to buy some champions with RP since I really wanted them but had to buy Runes instead. It's not entirely fair.

Everyone I've referred to play has stopped playing because of this. Champions cost too much, and Runes don't make it any easier. Not to mention you have to get to Lv 30 to make full use of masteries. From the beginning you're set to Shit Tier, and have to dedicate time into getting anywhere near decent/full content experience.

It's bad enough the game makes you invest time to learn the different champions, mechanics, and even find the champions/play style that fit you best. But to ask you spend even more time, simply so you won't have to pay real money for content, is just ridiculous.

Your 200 games to reach level 30 is an underestimate.

It takes 40,084 xp to get from level 1 to level 30.  To do that is only 200 games, you would have to _average_ 200 xp per game.  I haven't gotten more than 170 xp for a win, but I also haven't had many games go longer past 50 minutes.  Wikia says that the max xp for a normal is 198, which I can believe.

200 _wins_ might be more accurate, especially if you assume roughly 0.500 winning percentage (and thus 400 total games).

I think rune prices are fine as is. The reason they're fairly costly, is the fact that they give players an edge in the game. Once youve got your runes, youre all set and instantly have an advantage as soon as the game starts

It's the opposite. When you first hit 20 any player who has a full set of tier 3 runes has an immense advantage over you, especially during the laning phase. Then when you make it all the way to 30 if you haven't filled up that rune page you are again at a massive disadvantage. In addition picking up any champ who requires an unusual runepage (tryn, critplank, hybrid champs) you now have to farm ip in order to be on par with other players.

Runes aren't an optional advantage at a premium, they are a minimum for play. Making runes cost IP is a tax designed to make buying IP boosts for real money appealing. Actually I am not personally offended by this tactic in a free to play game, but I think Riot has outgrown it and should simply make them free.
